name: Sauteed Shrimp
author: D Keach
summary: These sauteed shrimp are great over grits or white rice. Adapted from Marge Jonte Mahoney, Greeleyville, SC.
ingredients: 3 pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 sprig fresh rosemary, chopped, or to taste
¾ cup white wine, or to taste
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, or to taste
directions: Squeeze lemon over shrimp and set aside
Heat olive oil over medium heat
Season with salt and pepper and cook until tender, about 5 minutes
Stir in rosemary, basil, oregano, coriander, and bay leaf
Add white wine and Worcestershire sauce; cook until sauce is slightly reduced and flavors come together, 8 to 10 minutes
Add shrimp to the sauce and cook until pink, 5 to 7 minutes more
